entry.title: Supporting Armenian democracy and the Armenian people÷â An interview with the NED president

media:group.media:title: Supporting Armenian democracy and the Armenian people÷â An interview with the NED president
media:group.media:description:
Damon Wilson is the President and CEO of the National Endowment for Democracy, a Washington-based non-profit that provides grants to grow and strengthen democratic institutions around the world. Mr. Wilson sat down with CivilNet to discuss NED‚Äôs work in Armenia and the region, the Armenian government‚Äôs reform agenda, and ongoing normalization efforts with Azerbaijan and Turkey.

entry.title: Aghavno and Berdzor Armenians may be relocated to two nearby villages

media:group.media:title: Aghavno and Berdzor Armenians may be relocated to two nearby villages
media:group.media:description:
Armenia‚Äôs parliament voted 66-0 at a special session to remove two prominent opposition deputies, Ishkhan Saghatelyan and Vahe Hakobyan, from their leadership positions for excessive absenteeism. The residents of Aghavno and Berdzor may be relocated to the nearby villages of Hin Shen and Mets Shen, says Artsakh‚Äôs Human Rights Defender Gegham Stepanyan. This comes after Armenia and Artsakh‚Äôs leadership confirmed that the Berdzor subregion will be handed to Azerbaijan in accordance with the November 9, 2020 statement.

entry.title: The intersection of science and defense

media:group.media:title: The intersection of science and defense
media:group.media:description:
Areg Danagoulian is an associate professor of Nuclear Science and Engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in the United States. Professor Danagoulian sat down with CivilNet to discuss the intersection of science, education, and national security. He also talked about the Metsamor nuclear power plant and the recent launch of Armenia‚Äôs first space satellite.
